To kick off my review I'll say this game has a lot of good and a lot of bad. It's really a mixed bag of highs and lows. The studio is actually significantly larger than I originally thought, which colours my opinion of the game a little bit. They are able to do cool stuff with the amount of people they've got working on the game but there is some stuff that is really inexcusable given the size of the team. I'll kick it off with the good.

Good:
- Constant flow of new material. They release new killers, survivors, and maps about 3 times per year. It's really impressive that they've managed to keep this consistent of a release schedule with new and interesting content.

- Exciting gameplay on both sides. Both killers and survivors have fun and interesting gameplay mechanics which make each game exciting whether you choose to do the killing or escaping. This makes for a game which you can sink a lot of hours in without getting bored.

- Great to play as a team. Whether it's surviving with your friends or simply trying to find out how to cooperate with random players the survivor side of the game is a lot of fun when working together. There is little more exciting than pulling off the great escape with each member playing perfectly to get everyone out alive. 

- Great customs match feature. In customs match you can queue up together with up to 5 people. 1 playing killer and the rest survivor. What's so great about the feature is that you can try out builds which you haven't unlocked or even have access to in public matches. I wish you could try out characters which you haven't bought here but I understand why you can't.

The Bad:

- Poor performance. This is among my biggest gripes. The game is very poorly optimized and constantly has issues with performance even with good internet and a good computer. I used to excuse this a little bit because I thought the game studio was smaller. When I found out the size of the team I was flabbergasted that they didn't allocate more resources into optimizing and stabilizing the game. Performance issues can be anything from standard lag and poor connection to stuff like maps needing to be disabled constantly  because most people can't play on them. 

- Asymmetrical gameplay can be as toxic as it is exciting. Due to the nature of the game being a 1 vs 4 game where 1 player is literally attempting to murder the other 4 there is going to be high tension between the two sides. This is exacerbated by certain gameplay mechanics and strategies. The same things which make the game most exciting can also lead to the game's most frustrating moments. 

Grindy and costly. The base game is pretty good cost wise and goes on sale often. However, one of the core gameplay mechanics, perks, are essentially locked behind DLC's, which can add up when you release so many of them. There is a mechanic which allows for you to get these perks without buying the DLC's, but the amount of playtime you would have to put in to get the in game resources to do so is staggering and is gated with RNG. In addition to this the 

- Graphics. This game is no work of art. The graphics have improved substantially over the years but in game it certainly doesn't look great. This is made up for by having interesting characters, but sometimes things can get bland to look at. 

Overall I'd give the game 3/5. The performance issues really knocks the game down the ladder for me but it's undeniably got a lot of exciting gameplay.
